data.title: A Hidden Gem
data.text: My husband and I were recently visiting Vancouver and were looking for something sweet... we googled dessert places near us, and Ice Cream Renaissance popped up. Holy moly, what a fantastic little shop. Everything is homemade, small batch, and immensely delicious. The staff was friendly, the place itself is clean and bright and welcoming, and the atmosphere was relaxing. Highly, highly recommend this place if you're looking for something to satisfy your sweet tooth.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: My sister lives in Vancouver and had us visit Ice Cream Renaissance.  We arrived and were able to taste several flavors before we each ordered 2 scoops.  The ice cream was served in large white bowls and the scoops were massive!  The presentation felt comforting, like eating a bowl of ice cream on a couch, but the flavors are so much better!  My husband and I visited again before we left because we enjoyed it so much.

data.title: Ice Cream Yum
data.text: After happy hour at the Barrel Room up the street, we found Ice Cream Renaissance. What a wonderful place. The ice cream is home made (I had honey vanilla) with a menu of other delectable flavors. The service is superb and friendly, and the atmosphere is country French. The staff is proud of their home made ice cream as they well should be. We will be going back!

data.title: HOLY Ice cream, this place is awesome.
data.text: I cannot stress how delicious the ice cream is at Ice Cream Renaissance. The flavors are familiar and unique, twists on the ice cream flavors of your youth. They have vegan options too (vegan ice cream and sorbet) that are equally delicious. I had a mango strawberry sorbet that had big chunks of fruit, it was light and refreshing and everything you hope for in a sorbet (I had just chowed hard on some spicy, amazing Thai food).  Serving sizes generous, prices judicious.  We got a two scoop cone that was as tall as the length of my daughter's head and it was $4.25; she couldn't finish it. I will be back and I will come hungry!!!

data.title: Amazing choices
data.text: Follow the crowd! It was a sunny and warm Sunday eve and we were lucky not to be too far down the line and a table was available outside. And inside too. Had Bittersweet chocolate and coffee-espresso. Multiple choices of cones including gluten-free. To go or eat there. Yummy looking pastries and even banana splits.

data.title: Great Local Ice Cream
data.text: My family has been going here for years. Great options for people with food allergies. Love the atmosphere and the service!

data.title: Good ice cream
data.text: I tried the not so leaning tower of Pisa which is a reverse sandwich cookie.  It contains one chocolate chip cookie sandwiched between two scoops of ice cream.  I tried the it with the Honey Vanilla and Peanut Butter Blitz.  You definitely taste the honey in the vanilla.  The peanut butter is a must for peanut butter lovers.

data.title: So wanted it to be a "5" but it just wasn't there.  Friendly staff and cute place
data.text: Tried this for the first time last night and I was disappointed.  The place is really cute and downtown Vancouver needs a shop like this.  Indoor and outdoor seating and great customer service.  Friendly when we ordered and came out to check on us since we were sitting outside.  The problem was with the quality of the ice cream.  Two of us got chocolate and one vanilla and none tasted like premium ice cream.  Wasn't creamy (almost granually) and reminded of "ice milk" we ate in my childhood.  The cookie and the toppings I had were good.    In reading other reviews, I see there are similar comments about the quality of the ice cream.  For the prices charged, I'm hoping they upgrade their ice cream.  If they do and future reviews reflect it, I'll be back!

data.title: Liked it :)
data.text: If you're looking for Baskin-Robbins you're at the wrong place. Handmade ice cream nice selection of flavors. Nice staff. Would definitely come back! :) Even gluten-free cones and vegan options

data.title: Terrible Ice Cream Quality
data.text: I was so disappointed by this place. My husband and I love ice cream and were really excited to visit here. I am glad I tasted some of the flavors before buying. The ice cream is extremely grainy and had chunks of ice in it. Literally all the flavors I tried were like this. I make ice cream myself and this shows low quality ingredients and low milk fat content. The only passable flavor was peanut butter, and that's probably because peanut butter has a high fat content to it added some creaminess to the ice cream. The service was not bad, in fact the young guy working the counter was really friendly, but unfortunately I expect to go to an ice cream shop and pay $5 for good quality and taste.

data.title: Chocolate Flavored Ice
data.text: Wow, by the size of the line, I expected great ice cream.  Instead, I paid $5 for a waffle cone chock full of chocolate flavored ICE!  Worst ice cream I have ever had.  Store brand ice cream is better than this.  There was so much ice, it was crunchy!  Font waste your money here.

data.title: Popular place
data.text:
Great ice cream, pie, and coffee
Natural, small batch, locally owned
Pleasant staff
Nice atmosphere 
Good place for kids parties
